lead_paragraph: ZERVOUDAKIS--Ioannis A.,M.D., a distinguished and widely-respected obstetrician and gynecologist, passed away peacefully at his home in Manhattan on July 8, 2016. He was surrounded by his family. Dr. Zervoudakis was an Associate Attending Obstetrician and Gynecologist at New York-Presbyterian Hospital and an Associate Professor of Clinical Obstetrics and Gynecology at Weill Cornell Medical College. Dr. Zervoudakis practiced and taught at Weill Cornell since 1971, except for the period of 1979-1991 in which he returned to Athens, Greece, to teach and practice at the Alexandra Hospital and LITO Maternity Hospital. Dr. Zervoudakis earned his Medical Degree from the University of Athens in 1963 and his Ph.D. from the National University of Athens Faculty of Medicine. After obtaining his degrees, he completed his military service as a doctor in the Greek Navy. His post- doctoral training included an internship at Coney Island Hospital, a residency and the position of Chief Resident at The New York Hospital-Cornell University Medical Center, and a Fellowship in Maternal and Fetal Medicine at Cornell University Medical College. He was born on June 17, 1943, in Greece to his parents, Dr. Andreas Zervoudakis, also an obstetrician and gynecologist, and Aliki Zervoudakis (born Papaleonardou). He devoted his life to his family and the practice of medicine and estimated that he delivered over 20,000 babies during his career. Dr. Zervoudakis specialized in high-risk obstetrics and his research lead to the development of new techniques in treating uterine fibroids. He was a pioneer of the "fetus as patient" concept. He was a two-time Lalor Foundation Fellow and grant recipient from the National Institute of Health. Dr. Zervoudakis adored classical music and was a gourmet chef. He was a true gourmand and an extraordinarily generous and kind man. He enjoyed spending time with this wife, his children and his grandchildren. In his youth he was a well-respected scout leader of the Scouts of Greece or Soma Hellinon Proskopon. Dr. Zervoudakis was a member of the Hellenic Medical Society of New York, and served on the Board of Trustees of the Archdiocesan Cathedral of the Holy Trinity. Dr. Zervoudakis is survived by his wife of nearly 46 years Rallou, his daughters Alice, Christina and Laura, sons-in- law Jim and Adam, grandchildren Natalie, John (his namesake), Alexander and Andreas, all of Manhattan, his sister Sophia Gouras and his nephews Andreas and Konstantinos Gouras, of Athens, Greece. Visitation at Frank E. Campbell Funeral Home at 1076 Madison Ave on Monday, July 11, 2016, from 2:00-4:00pm and 6:00-9:00pm. Funeral services on Tuesday, July 12, 2016, at Holy Trinity Cathedral at 319 East 74th Street at 11:00am, with the repast Makaria luncheon to follow. Memorial donations may be made in Dr. Zervoudakis' memory to the Hellenic Medical Society of New York at (718) 398-2440 and to Dr. Howard I. Scher's prostate cancer research at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (646) 227-3546. 1/3
